oai_dc:dc.dc:title: American Generals, War of 1812
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Black and white patriotic lithograph depicts Generals Henry Dearborn, Winfield Scott, Andrew Jackson, William Henry Harrison, Jacob Jennings Brown, and Zebulon Pike. Image is decorated with cannon barrel, sabers, olive branches, and a U.S. flag.

Henry Dearborn (1751-1829) was a veteran of the Revolutionary War, but was a mediocre commander during the War of 1812. Jacob Jennings Brown (1775-1828) had successes in the North during the war that made him a hero. Winfield Scott (1796-1866) became the longest-serving American general in history. Andrew Jackson (1767-1845) was effective in the Creek Campaign and at the Battle of New Orleans. William Henry Harrison (1773-1841) commanded the Army of the Northwest during the war.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tanner, Vallance, Kearney & Co., engravers
